content:
• Wednesday, May 16, 2018
  • NTES

    NetEase -4.1% as forex losses spur miss on earnings

    • In first-quarter earnings, NetEase (NASDAQ:NTES) fell well short of profit expectations while revenues came in at the high side thanks to heavy gains outside its core gaming business.
    • Shares are down 4.1% in after-hours trade.
    • Net revenues of 14.2B yuan (about $2.3B) were up 3.9% Y/Y.
    • Non-GAAP net income, meanwhile, fell to 1.3B yuan (about $213.2M) from last quarter's 1.9B yuan and the prior year's 4.3B yuan; NetEase took a heavier foreign exchange loss of 375.1M yuan (vs. last quarter's 159.1M yuan and last year's 48.5M yuan) due mainly to unrealized exchange losses from dollar-denominated bank deposits and short-term loan balances.
    • Adjusted earnings per ADR were $1.61, below expectations for $2.15.
    • Revenue by segment: Online game services, 8.8B yuan (about $1.4B, down 18.4% in yuan terms); E-commerce, 3.7B yuan (about $595M, up 101%); Advertising services, 462M yuan (about $73.7M, up 3.8%); E-mail and others, 1.2B yuan ($194.1M, up 102%).
    • Liquidity came to 43.5B yuan (about $6.9B), up slightly from 43.2B yuan as of Dec. 31. Cash flow from operations was 1.9B yuan, down from last quarter's 3.9B yuan and last year's 4B yuan.
    • Conference call to come at 9 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 7:31 PM | 13 Comments
  • ESND

    Essendant +6.1% as Staples takes 9.9% stake, pursues buyout talks

    • Essendant (NASDAQ:ESND) is up 6.1% after hours after an SEC filing notes Staples, now owned by Sycamore Partners, has taken a 9.9% stake in the company and is looking for acquisition talks.
    • Staples sent a letter on April 17 expressing an interest in buying Essendant outright, but Essendant replied that it wasn't able to talk with Staples under an April 12 merger plan with Genuine Parts Co. (NYSE:GPC).
    • On May 10, Essendant sent Staples a draft of an "Acceptable Confidentiality Agreement" under its merger plan, which Staples is currently reviewing.
    • If that works out, Staples plans to pursue talks under its previous terms.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:38 PM
  • LOXO

    Loxo Oncology +18% as cancer drug shows promise in early trial

    • Loxo Oncology (NASDAQ:LOXO) +17.9% after-hours following preliminary results which showed that its new LOXO-292 experimental cancer drug led to tumor shrinkage in nearly 70% of patients regardless of where their cancer originated.
    • The drug reportedly was well tolerated by patients with advanced cancer, many of whom were resistant to or no longer being helped by available treatments.
    • The oral treatment is intended for cancer patients with RET abnormalities in which two genes become fused together, triggering accelerated cancer cell growth.
    • Blueprint Medicines (NASDAQ:BPMC), which is developing a rival drug, -9% after-hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • HUYA

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (05/16/2018)

    • Top gainers: HUYA +1.8%. EXTR +1.6%. ADT +1.5%. KEM +1.5%. ATUS +1.1%.
    • Top Losers: ACXM -7.5%. CSCO -4.1%.  JACK -2.8%. SE -2.5%. BILI -1.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 6 Comments
  • EXTR

    Extreme Networks +2.9% as filings show insider buys

    • Extreme Networks (NASDAQ:EXTR) is up 2.9% postmarket after a series of after-closing Form 4 filings show insiders making purchases of stock.
    • CEO Ed Meyercord bought 20,000 shares outright at $8.42 each on Monday (and also exercised some performance shares and restricted stock along the way).
    • Robert Gault, the company's executive VP of Worldwide Sales Services, also exercised some performance and RSU-based options.
    • And director Edward Kennedy acquired 50,000 shares over the past couple of days: 45,183 at $8.613, and another 4,817 at $8.6432.
    • Shares closed today up 2.1%, at $8.75.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:32 PM | 2 Comments
  • JE

    Just Energy misses on revenue

    • Just Energy (NYSE:JE): Q4 EPS of C$1.40.
    • Revenue of C$1.01B (+6.6% Y/Y) misses by C$100M.
    • Shares +4.27% AH.
    • Press Release

  • DL

    China Distance Education reports Q2 results

    • China Distance Education (NYSE:DL): Q2 EPADS of -$0.082
    • Revenue of $29.75M (+36.1% Y/Y)
    • Shares +1.99% AH.

    | 5:12 PM
  • RAMP

    Dim full-year guidance sinks Acxiom, down 7.8%

    • Acxiom (NYSE:ACXM) is off 7.8% after hours following fiscal Q4 earnings where it beat the Street but guided below consensus in its fiscal 2019 view.
    • The company swung to an operating gain of $5M, vs. a loss of $9M a year ago, and non-GAAP operating income rose 61% to $34M.
    • Net earnings swung to a gain as well, to $0.06/share from a loss of $0.10/share. Non-GAAP EPS rose to $0.27 from $0.15.
    • But for fiscal 2019, it's guiding to revenues of $935M-$955M (below consensus for $972.4M) and non-GAAP EPS of $0.90-$0.95 (below expectations for $1.02).
    • Operating cash flow in Q4 was $36M, up from $31M; free cash flow to equity was $14M (vs. a year-ago $26M).
    • Revenue by segment: Connectivity, $57M (up 30%); Audience Solutions, $88M (up 2%); Marketing Services, $99M (up 5%).
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM
  • TTWO

    Take-Two resumes down 5.5% after revenue miss, low guidance

    • Take-Two Interactive Software (NASDAQ:TTWO) is coming out of a halt down 5.5% after Q4 earnings where revenue fell short of expectatinos and the company guided low for fiscal 2019.
    • Net revenue (adjusted for GAAP deferrals) was $411.4M, missing an expected $444M.
    • Recurring spending grew 42% Y/Y and made up 44% of total net revenue (thanks again, Grand Theft Auto). Digitally delivered net revenue rose 8% to $301.4M.
    • Catalog made up $293.1M of $411.4M in net bookings.
    • Net cash from operations was $393.9M, up 19%. At quarter's end, the company had cash and short-term investments of $1.424B.
    • For Q1, it's starting guidance on GAAP net revenue of $345M-$395M with net bookings at $215M-$265M (below consensus for $379.6M). It sees GAAP EPS at $0.53-$0.63.
    • For the full year, it's guiding to GAAP net revenue of $2.5B$2.6B and net bookings of $2.67B-$2.77B (below an expected $2.84B). It's forecasting GAAP EPS of $1.53-$1.80, and capex of about $60M. Net cash from operations is expected at $710M.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM | 17 Comments
  • ORIG

    Ocean Rig UDW -1% after Q1 earnings miss

    • Ocean Rig UDW (NASDAQ:ORIG) -1.2% after-hours as Q1 earnings fall well short of analyst expectations while revenues beat estimates but slide 36% Y/Y to $194M.
    • Results include operating costs of $11.8M, or $0.13/share, associated with shipyard stays for the Ocean Rig Mykonos and the Leiv Eirikssson; otherwise, Q1 net income would have totaled $66.7M, or $0.73/share.
    • Q1 adjusted EBITDA fell by nearly half from the year-ago quarter to $111M from $211M, and rigs operating under drilling contracts achieved a revenue efficiency of 98.1%in the period.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • CSCO

    Cisco -3.2% after largely in-line Q3 earnings

    • Cisco Systems (NASDAQ:CSCO) has slipped 3.2% after logging fiscal Q3 earnings that beat profit expectations and featured in-line guidance for the current quarter.
    • Revenue rose mostly as expected, by 4.4%, with heavier growth in Applications and Security. Recurring revenue made up 32% of total (up 2 points Y/Y).
    • Gross margin was 63.9% and product gross margin was 62.9%, down from last year's 63.2% due largely to pricing and higher memory costs (non-GAAP).
    • “We are executing well against our strategy, our innovation pipeline has never been stronger, and we continue to make great progress in transforming towards more software and subscriptions,” says CEO/Chairman Chuck Robbins.
    • Revenue breakout: Product, $9.3B (up 4.7%); Service, $3.16B (up 3.4%). By Product: Infrastructure Platforms, $7.16B (up 2%); Applications, $1.31B (up 19%); Security, $583M (up 11%); Other, $249M (down 6%).
    • Revenue by segment: Americas, $7.16B (up 2%); EMEA, $3.28B (up 9%); APJC, $2.02B (up 7%).
    • For Q4, it's guiding to revenues of $12.62B-$12.86B (vs. consensus for $12.72B) and EPS of $0.68-$0.70 (vs. expectations for $0.69).
    • Conference call to come at 4:30 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 18 Comments
  • CBS

    Judge punts decision on CBS/NAI feud to morning

    • A judge has granted CBS a temporary restraining order against National Amusements and Shari Redstone until he can make a decision tomorrow morning, THR's Eriq Gardner reports.
    • That puts on hold NAI's rewrite of CBS bylaws, a move designed to keep CBS from issuing a dividend that would dilute the 79% voting power that NAI holds over the company.
    • And that means the decision will come the same day as a scheduled CBS board meeting to consider the dilutive move -- all a result of CBS opposition to Redstone's plan to re-merge the company with Viacom (VIA -2.9%, VIAB -0.1%).
    • CBS is down 1.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 3 Comments
  • LYB

    LyondellBasell upgraded to Buy, PPG downgraded to Hold at Jefferies

    • LyondellBasell (LYB +2.7%) ranks among today's top performers in the materials stock sector after its shares were upgraded to Buy from Hold at Jefferies with a $137 price target, raised from $118.
    • The firm says LYB's current stock price does not fully reflect the potential for higher oil prices in H2 2018 and in 2019, favorable demand trends and the company's strong balance sheet.
    • Conversely, Jefferies downgrades PPG (PPG +0.3%) to Hold from Buy with a $110 price target, cut from $135,
    • The firm says persistent concerns over pricing lagging higher oil-derived raw material costs and the reliance on buybacks to protect earnings growth could push PPG's relative multiple to 10%-15% below the market over the next two years.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 4 Comments
  • SPOT

    Churn challenge prompts Wells to start Spotify at Market Perform

    • Wells Fargo has initiated coverage of Spotify (NYSE:SPOT) at Market Perform, pointing to both a solid position in the streaming field and a challenge ahead converting premium users.
    • Analyst Peter Stabler says brand recognition of Spotify is second only to Pandora (P +5%), and users are satisfied.
    • Maybe too satisfied: According to Stabler's survey, non-premium users all report limited interest in the company's paid tier. And the company recently added improved discovery features to th ad-supported level, a further disincentive to switching to paid.
    • He has a price target of $150; shares are up 1.4% to $160.97 today, implying 7% downside in Wells' target.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM | 6 Comments
  • NAT

    Nordic American Tankers +2% as Q1 loss not as severe as feared

    • Nordic American Tanker (NAT +1.7%) is higher after reporting a lighter than expected Q1 loss despite a 46% Y/Y drop in revenues to $29M from $55M in the year-ago quarter.
    • The time charter equivalent NAT's vessels during Q1 was $11,200/day per ship but the company says it is "well positioned when the tanker market improves," noting that the historic average market rate for the last 25 years was ~$30K/day per suezmax vessel.
    • NAT says its net debt of $8.9M per vessel is among the lowest in the industry.
    • Also: SDRL +30.7%, NAO +0.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM | 22 Comments
  • HMNY

    MoviePass in a nutshell

    • The Wall Street Journal's Ben Fritz is the latest to take a shot at the MoviePass model in an article detailing the losses that are piling up at the company and for investors.
    • Putting the exclamation point on the situation is the WSJ's interview with MoviePass customer and investor Michael D'Ariano.
    • "I’m saving $70 a month going to the movies and losing thousands investing in the company that’s letting me do that,” observed D’Ariano.
    • Yesterday, Helios said that without raising extra capital there is substantial doubt about its ability to continue as a going concern through May 15, 2019.
    • Shares of MoviePass owner Helios and Matheson Analytics (NASDAQ:HMNY) are up 5.76% on the day, but trade at only $0.68.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM | 65 Comments

  • TEUM

    Pareteum awarded $2M agreement for WiFi services

    • Pareteum's (TEUM +1.5%) existing U.S. Wireless Internet Service Provider customer will expand connectivity options by adding SmartConnect technology through Pareteum's Global Cloud Service Platform, a single source solution.
    • The amendment to the existing agreement will add $2 million in revenue to the existing 3-year contract.
    • Previously: Pareteum to embed iPass technology in platform worldwide (May 14)
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM | 9 Comments
  • JAKK

    Toy sector consolidation anticipated

    • JAKKS Pacific (JAKK +11.5%), Hasbro (HAS +1.1%) and Mattel (MAT +2.3%) are higher after Reuters profiles how M&A in the toy industry could increase as a result of the Toys 'R' Us bankruptcy. It's a different story in Canada, where Spin Master (OTC:SNMSF) is down 2.22%.
    • The Reuters pieces suggests that smaller brands could be looking to sell to larger companies as part of the sector-wide consolidation push.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM | 3 Comments
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney expected to have volatile earnings day

    • J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) is up 3.26% amid a rally in the department store sector stoked by strong guidance from Macy's.
    • The action today could be a mild preview for the volatility tomorrow after J.C. Penney reports Q1 earnings before the bell. Bloomberg reports that options trading on JCP implies a 17% move in share price up or down, compared to the historic norm on earnings day of a 7% move.
    • Consensus estimate on JCP are for revenue of $2.61B and EPS of -$0.22 off a gross margin rate of 35.8%. Analysts expect full-year EPS of $0.18 out of the retailer.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 12 Comments
  • ENPH

    Enphase Energy +7% as H.C. Wainwright starts with Buy rating

    • Enphase Energy (ENPH +6.7%) surges to a 52-week high before pulling back after H.C. Wainwright analysts initiate coverage with a Buy rating and $8 stock price target.
    • Wainwright cites ENPH's pace of new product launches, emphasis on cost reductions, and focus on expanding its addressable markets as key drivers that should support near-term growth and profitability.
    • The firm believes the impact from these catalysts already is beginning to reflect in ENPH's financials, and investors have reacted favorably.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM | 3 Comments
  • FSI

    Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (05/16/2018)

    • Gainers: FSI +15%. LONE +13%. CGG-OLD +12%. LGCY +9%. QES +8%.
    • Losers: SAEX -19%. AMRS -8%. WMLP-OLD -7%. OMN -6%. VHI -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • KKR

    Citi's Katz a believer in KKR's C-corp conversion; shares up 4%

    • KKR (KKR +4.2%) is an outlier to the upside in the private-equity space today after an upgrade to Buy from Citi's William Katz.
    • Previously: KKR drops partnership structure, tops estimates; shares up nearly 9% (May 3)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • GME

    GameStop rally fizzles out as Tiger threat discounted

    • GameStop (GME -0.4%) confirms that it received a letter from Tiger Management asking the company to initiate a strategic review.
    • Tiger says it will sell its block of shares if it doesn't see a turnaround develop within a short time frame.
    • Loop Capital thinks Tiger's rather small stake in GameStop and willingness to bail isn't enough leverage to force GameStop to act (per Bloomberg).
    • Shares of GameStop have reversed after an initial push higher this morning.
    • Previously: GameStop jumps after Tiger Management digs in (May 16)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM | 12 Comments
  • NKE

    Nike breaks to new all-time high

    • Nike (NYSE:NKE) is up 2.71% on the day and carved out a new all-time high of $71.50 earlier in the day.
    • Shares of Nike are now up 14% YTD and 38% over the last 52 weeks as investors brush aside some of the recent turmoil over accusations of a toxic corporate culture in Beaverton.
    • A strong earning report from Macy's this morning has created some buying action in the retail sector today. Of course, Nike has a strong presence at Macy's stores and on the Macy's website.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM | 18 Comments
  • DCAR

    DropCar slides 10.5% post Q1 results

    • DropCar (DCAR -10.6%) reports Q1 revenue growth of 660.9% Y/Y to $4.87M.
    • Automotive revenues expanded ~139% Y/Y to $1.7M.
    • Dropcar B2B: Segment revenues were up 139% Y/Y, driven by organic growth of existing enterprise customers & the onboarding of new top-tier automotive partners, particularly in the car sharing segment. Increased number of automotive clients drove ~240% Y/Y growth in B2B job volumes.
    • Dropcar Consumer: Q1 was strategically successful for consumer segments (WILL & STEVE), in terms of positioning, market testing & price discovery. The company increased it's base STEVE subscription rate from $349 to $379 / month; STEVE’s Q1 revenues grew 140% Y/Y & 10% Q/Q.
    • DropCar’s low voltage contracting business, which was acquired during the WPCS merger, had a strong Q1, generating revenues of $3.2M, gross margins of $0.9M & operating income of $0.3M. The management has decided to explore & consider strategic alternatives for this stand-alone contracting segment as it does not provide meaningful revenue, operational or strategic synergies.
    • Previously: DropCar reports Q1 results (May 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • GAIN

    Gladstone Investment falls as FQ4 NII hit by capital gains-related fees

    • Gladstone Investment (GAIN -2.1%) fell after reporting FQ4 adjusted NII of 21 cents per share from 25 cents a year ago, beating by 2 cents.
    • Unadjusted, though, NII for the quarter was 10 cents per share, including 11 cents of capital gains-based incentive fees accrued during the quarter. That compares with NII of 2 cents per share in the year-ago period.
    • These fees were accrued in accordance with U.S. GAAP, the payment of which is not contractually due under the terms of its investment advisory agreement, in the current period,the company said.
    • Previously: Gladstone Investment beats by $0.02, beats on total investment income (May 15)
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM | 19 Comments
  • BT

    BT Group at seven-year low as bullish Bernstein downgrades

    • BT Group (NYSE:BT) is 1.8% lower on NYSE and at a seven-year low following a loss of faith from bullish Bernstein, throwing in the towel with a downgrade to Market Perform.
    • The firm sees "signs of a business in turmoil" in dim guidance and a restructuring program, and shares are likely to stay at low levels for a while, the firm says. There's a "dramatic erosion" of earnings capacity and flat outlook for growth ahead. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • The firm has cut its price target to £2.15 from £3.05; shares closed in London at £2.03 today.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM
  • ESNC

    EnSync up 3% on Q3 results

    • EnSync (ESNC +3.2%) reported Q3 revenue growth of 6040% Y/Y to $3.1M, which was majorly contributed by 10 power purchase agreement projects.
    • Q3 overall gross margin improved by 300 bps to 27.2% and operating margin recovered by 8,64,243 bps to -94.2%.
    • Advanced engineering and development expenses declined by 19.5% Y/Y to $1.18M and SG&A declined by 10.5% Y/Y to $2.48M due to reduction in stock-based compensation.
    • Net inventories were at $1.45M as of 31 March 2018.
    • Company has 12 PPA projects in backlog and estimates value at $16M.
    • “We have expanded our product portfolio beyond our historic commercial and industrial application to now include utility and residential system applications. On the utility side, through projects like the Africa Micro-Utility system we recently announced, we have entered the independent utility systems business, where we are effectively a proxy for a utility. For our residential application, we recently debuted our new EnSync Home Energy System”, mentioned Brad Hansen, CEO.
    • Previously: EnSync beats by $0.01, misses on revenue (May 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM | 6 Comments

  • CELG

    Biotechs perk up ahead of ASCO abstract drop

    • The SPDR S&P Biotech ETF (XBI +1.1%) is up 1% as investors ramp up buying ahead of the abstract drop for the American Society of Clinical Oncology (ASCO) Annual Meeting in Chicago, June 1 - 5.
    • The abstracts should be released at 5:00 pm ET today.
    • Virtually all companies with any presence at all in cancer will have data presented.
    • Selected tickers: (CELG)(BLUE +0.2%)(LOXO +1.4%)(OTCQX:RHHBY +0.5%)(BMY +0.3%)(MRK +0.8%)(AZN +0.6%)(ABBV +0.8%)(DVAX +1.3%)(GTHX +5%)(IDRA +4.2%)(EPZM -0.6%)(FGEN +1.4%)(IMGN +3%)(GILD +1.3%)(PFE +0.3%)(LLY -0.6%)(JNJ +0.5%)(AMGN +0.9%)(CLVS +2.2%)(TSRO +0.9%)

  • VDSI-OLD

    VASCO Data Security -2.8% on analyst downgrade

    • Sidoti downgrades VASCO Data Security (NASDAQ:VDSI-OLD) from Buy to Neutral.
    • VASCO Data Security shares are down 2.8% to $20.21.  
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • VIPS

    Vipshop +3.8% in face of pair of downgrades

    • Vipshop Holdings (VIPS +3.8%) is rallying in the face of downgrades after its earnings prompted a sell-off this week.
    • KeyBanc has downgraded to Sector Weight from Overweight, pointing to "uncertain visibility of T/J contributions [those from partners Tencent and JD.com] and secular margin pressure" that more than make up for possible growth re-acceleration and multiple expansion. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • The bank cut its price target to $13 from $20; shares have jumped to $12.54 on NYSE today.
    • Meanwhile, Daiwa has downgraded the shares to Hold as well, with a price target cut to $16 from $25.
    • Earnings call slides
    • Earnings call transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 4 Comments
  • IQV

    IQVIA down 5% on opioid data integrity issues

    • IQVIA (IQV -5.1%) slips on almost a 5x surge in volume in apparent response to an announcement by the FDA that has identified errors in the former's National Sales Perspectives (NSP) database related to certain opioids, a source it uses to track the number of prescriptions written in the U.S.
    • The data discrepancy showed more than a 20% drop in the amount of kilograms of fentanyl sold over at least the past five years compared to what IQVIA had previously reported, now believed to be an overestimation due to its use of the wrong weight-based conversion factors to determine the amount of fentanyl in a given unit (such as a fentanyl patch) for a subset of fentanyl products. IQVIA has since corrected the errors.
    • The agency also identified data quality issues related to other controlled substances with similar weight-based conversion factors, including oxymorphone and hydrocodone. It says these additional errors "raise serious concerns about systematic issues with IQVIA's data and quality control procedures."
    • Update: In a statement, IQVIA says its internal processes identified the kilogram conversion problem prior to the FDA's notification and informed customers last month, adding that the issue does affect its U.S. and global dollar and unit information in the NSP database or any other of its services. Shares are down 3% in the last hour of the session but up over 8% from the intraday low of $91. 57.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM
  • SGLB

    Sigma Labs down 3.8% post Q1 results

    • Sigma Labs (SGLB -3.9%) reports Q1 revenue decrease of 9.1% to $0.1M.
    • The company signed a cooperative research & development agreement with the National Institute of Standards & Technology to assess production yields of metal additive manufacturing using the Company’s PrintRite3D® technology.
    • In Q1, the company raised additional capital in order to increase working capital & technology resources to both grow the company & develop closed loop control.
    • Q1 overall expenses: Operating was $1.18M (+1.7% Y/Y); Personnel costs of $0.6M which was 48% of total operating expenses; Outside Services Fees incurred were $0.3M (-11.1% Y/Y); Research & development $0.1M (+123.3% Y/Y), the increase resulted primarily from the purchase of multiple upgraded servers & various pieces of specialized equipment as part of continued concentrated acceleration of technology development in 2018.
    • Cash & equivalents of $1.3M (-13.3% Q/Q).
    • Previously: Sigma Labs reports Q1 results (May 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • BOLD

    Audentes reports positive results from study of AT132 in XLMTM; shares up 7%

    • Thinly traded Audentes Therapeutics (BOLD +6.6%) is up on more than double normal volume on the heels of its announcement of continued positive results from its Phase 1/2 clinical trial, ASPIRO, assessing gene therapy AT132 in patients with X-Linked Myotubular Myopathy (XLMTM), an inherited disorder characterized by extreme muscle weakness, respiratory failure and early death. The data were presented at the American Society of Gene and Cell Therapies Annual Meeting in Chicago.
    • Interim results on six patients showed treatment effects. All six experienced stable or increased neuromuscular function while five of six experienced improvements in respiratory function. A seventh patient has yet to reach the first timepoint.
    • On the safety front, there have been 24 adverse events (AEs), six serious. One occured in Patient 4 (gastroenteritis) which was determined to be unrelated to treatment. The other five occurred in Patient 3. One of the five, atrial tachycardia, was possibly treatment-related although the patient also experienced an episode prior to enrolling in the trial.
    • Previously: Audentes' gene therapy AT132 shows positive effect in XLMTM study; shares ahead 13% premarket (Jan. 4)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • SOHU

    • Update with details:
    • Analyst Christopher Rolland: “We believe Intel’s delay will help to maintain/improve AMD’s competitiveness for their next generation of Epyc and Ryzen products.   • SE

    Sea Limited +10% amid broad revenue growth in Q1

    • Sea Limited (NYSE:SE) is up 10.1% in NYSE trading following Q1 earnings where it added new growth in its gaming unit and exponentially increased its e-commerce wing.
    • Digital Entertainment adjusted revenues grew 42.6% and EBITDA rose 48.6% to $55M. Quarterly active users hit 126.7M, up 125% Y/Y and up 44.3% Q/Q. Average revenue per users was $1.2, vs. a year-ago $1.8.
    • In E-commerce, gross merchandise value was $1.9B, a tripling of last year's total and up 23% Q/Q. Gross orders were up 217% to 111.4M. EBITDA, though, was -$179.6M vs. a year-ago -$62.7M.
    • Revenue by segment: Digital Entertainment, $110.7M (up 26.3%); E-commerce, $27.3M (up from $34,000); Digital Financial Services, $3.7M (up 81.9%).
    • The company boosted full-year revenue guidance to $780M-$820M (40.9%-48.1% growth Y/Y) from a previous range of $730M-$770M. It also sees e-commerce GMV at $8.2B-$8.7B, up from $7.5B-$8B.
